data.title: Author: de%20Camp,%20L.%20Sprague%20(aka%20Abdul%20Alhazred,%20Lyon%20Sprague%20de%20Camp,%20L.%20S.%20de%20Camp,%20de%20Camp,%20L.%20Sarcophagus%20de%20Camp,%20Lyman%20R.%20Lyon,%20J.%20Wellington%20
data.text:
The Unbeheaded King -book 3 of the JORIAN Series ---by L Sprague De Camp -a Signed Copy (volume Three )

By: de Camp, L Sprague (SIGNED) (aka Abdul Alhazred, Lyon Sprague de Camp, L. S. de Camp, de Camp, L. Sarcophagus de Camp, Lyman R. Lyon, J. Wellington Wells )

Price: $24.95

Publisher: New York, NY, N.Y. / New York: Del Rey / Ballantine, 1983, 1st Paperback Edition, First Printing : 1983

Edition: First Printing

Inscription: Signed (see description)

Seller ID: 169275

ISBN-13: 9780345298409

Binding: Soft Cover

Condition: Near Fine (see description)

------------( 1st printing of the First paperback Edition ) ---paperback, a Near Fine copy, tight and square, a bit of very light rubbing, a bit of age toning to paper, signed "For Carol - L Sprague de Camp 10/25/85", any image directly beside this listing is the actual book and not a generic photo, /// SIGNED ---GUARANTEED to be AVAILABLE/// ---sizes are approximate (generally within 1/8 inch)---

View More...

H.P. Lovecraft: A Biography -by L Sprague de Camp ( Howard Phillips )

By: de Camp, L Sprague (aka Abdul Alhazred, Lyon Sprague de Camp, L. S. de Camp, de Camp, L. Sarcophagus de Camp, Lyman R. Lyon, J. Wellington Wells ) ( H.P. Lovecraft related)

Price: $28.69

Publisher: New York, NY, N.Y. / New York: Barnes and Noble, 1996, 1st B&N Edition, First Printing : 1996

Edition: First Edition

Inscription: Not Signed

Seller ID: 168682

ISBN-13: 9781566199940

Binding: Hard Cover

Condition: Near Fine (see description)

------------( 1st printing of the First B&N Edition ) ---hardcover, a Near Fine/Fine copy in a Near Fine/Fine dustjacket, unread, a wee hint of age toning to paper, 510 pages, a very readable biography, nice cover art by Murray Tinkelman, ---"Few writers have had more ironic, paradoxical lives that Howard Phillips Lovecraft (1890-1937), the great horror-fantasy writer of Providence, Rhode Island. Never having a book of his stories published in his lifetime, he became a best seller after his death. Dying in poverty and obscurity, convinced of his own utter failure, he has been hailed not only a...
